briefTitle: Comparing Efficacy and Safety of CinnaGen Beta Erythropoietin (CinnaPoietin®) Versus Eprex® on the Treatment of Anemia in ESRD Hemodialysis Patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Hb Change Level During the Last Four Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary endpoints of this study is to assess mean Hb change level during the last four weeks of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Weekly Epoetin Dosage Per kg Body Weight During the Last Four Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: The mean weekly epoetin dosage per kg body weight during the last four weeks of treatment necessary to maintain the Hb level within 10-12 g/dl during the last four weeks of treatment is considered as the second primary endpoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Proportion of Patients With Any Permanent or Transient Dose Change
outcomeMeasures.description: The proportion of patients with any permanent or transient dose change during 26 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Proportion of Patients With Any Hb Measurement Outside the Target Range (10-12 g/dl)
outcomeMeasures.description: The proportion of patients with any Hb measurement outside the target range (10-12 g/dl) during 26 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Proportion of Patients Needed Blood Transfusions
outcomeMeasures.description: The proportion of patients needed blood transfusions during 26 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Proportion of Patients With Treatment Success
outcomeMeasures.description: Treatment success is considered as Hb concentration equal to or more than 11.0 g/dl and two consecutive weeks without any blood transfusion within the preceding three months

outcomeMeasures.title: The Proportion of Patients With Maintenance Success
outcomeMeasures.description: Maintenance success is considered as maintenance success is considered as maintenance of mean Hb concentration of 11.0 ± 1.0 g/dl for at least four consecutive weeks

outcomeMeasures.title: The Percentage of Patients With Hb Measurements More Than 10.0 g/dl
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of patients with Hb measurements more than 10.0 g/dl from week 22 to week 26.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Percentage of Patients With Hematocrit Measurements More Than 30%
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of patients with hematocrit measurements more than 30% from week 22 to week 26.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Incidence of Hb Levels Above 13 g/dl
outcomeMeasures.description: The first safety endpoint is the proportion of patients with at least one Hb measurement above 13 g/dL.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Proportion of Patients With an Increase in Hb Concentration of > 1.0 g/dl for Four Consecutive Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: The proportion of patients with an increase in Hb concentration of \> 1.0 g/dl for four consecutive weeks during 26 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Incidence of Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: The incidence of adverse events during 26 weeks.

commonTop: (Palpitation, Cardiac Function Impairment, Cardiac Infraction, Chest Pain, Tachycardia)
(Skin reaction, Catheter defect, Disability catheter, Filter clots, pain in injection site, skin rea
(Respiratory disorder, chest pain and dyspenea, dyspnea)
(itching, echymosis due to recent car accident, itching)
